```{r, echo = TRUE, fig.width=8, fig.height=8}
#------------------------------------------LOADING-------------------------------------------------
require(FactoMineR)
require(dplyr)
require(ggplot2)
require(ggcorrplot)
require(bestNormalize)
require(reshape2)

full_best_df <- read.csv("C:/Users/A541U/Desktop/Semester 2/Descriptive R Project/2018_World_Happiness_Multivariate_Analysis/DATA/full_best_df.csv")

temp_df <- full_best_df %>% select(-X,-Country,-Region,-Compulsory_Education_in_Years,-Forest_Area_Land_Percentage)
```

PCA analysis on the 29 variables:

```{r, echo = TRUE, fig.width=8, fig.height=8}

pca1 <- PCA(temp_df, graph=TRUE)

```

Matrix with eigenvalues and cumulative percentange of variance:

```{r, echo = TRUE, fig.width=8, fig.height=8}
pca1$eig
```

Correlations between the Principal Components and the variables

```{r, echo = TRUE, fig.width=8, fig.height=8}
pca1$var$coord
```

```{r, echo = TRUE, fig.width=8, fig.height=8}

rownames(pca1$eig) <- full_best_df[2]


pca1$ind$coord
```
